publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-13.1 George Lyon: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-00013) in the name of Alex Salmond. Leave out all after "as soon as" and replace with "latest medical advice indicates that it would be safe to do so and in that context asks the Chief Medical Officer to come to Parliament to be questioned and asks Scottish Ministers to keep the Parliament fully informed of the wider implications for the Scottish beef industry of any premature decision" (lodged 27 May 1999). Supported by Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, Robert Brown

S1M-13.1 George Lyon: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-13) in the name of Alex Salmond, leave out all after "as soon as" and insert "latest medical advice indicates that it would be safe to do so and in that context (a) asks the Chief Medical Officer to come to Parliament to be questioned and (b) asks Scottish Ministers to keep the Parliament fully informed of the wider implications for the Scottish beef industry of any premature decision" (lodged on 27 May 1999). Supported by Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, Robert Brown

S1M-13.1 George Lyon: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-13) in the name of Alex Salmond, leave out all after "as soon as" and insert "latest medical advice indicates that it would be safe to do so and in that context (a) asks the Chief Medical Officer to come to Parliament to be questioned and (b) asks Scottish Ministers to keep the Parliament fully informed of the wider implications for the Scottish beef industry of any premature decision lodged on 27 May 1999)." Supported by Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, Robert Brown, Euan Robson*

S1M-13.1 George Lyon: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-13) in the name of Alex Salmond, leave out all after "as soon as" and insert "latest medical advice indicates that it would be safe to do so and in that context (a) asks the Chief Medical Officer to come to Parliament to be questioned and (b) asks Scottish Ministers to keep the Parliament fully informed of the wider implications for the Scottish beef industry of any premature decision." (lodged on 27 May 1999) Supported by Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, Robert Brown, Euan Robson

S1M-13.1 George Lyon: As an amendment to the motion (S1M-13) in the name of Alex Salmond, leave out all after "as soon as" and insert "latest medical advice indicates that it would be safe to do so and in that context— asks the Chief Medical Officer to come to Parliament to be questioned and asks Scottish Ministers to keep the Parliament fully informed of the wider implications for the Scottish beef industry of any premature decision." (lodged on 27 May) Supported by Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, Robert Brown, Euan Robson

(lodged on 27 May 1999) Supported by Mike Rumbles, Tavish Scott, Robert Brown, Euan Robson
